issues.title: Use logging library
issues.body: Sort out the best way to do this.

issues.title: improve how csv serializes Distribution  to disk
issues.body:
- [ ] include bin width in disk
- [ ] make edges related functions always include right edge
- [ ] add writer method for centers + val to DistributionSink api

commits.message:
Merge pull request #5 from tacaswell/core

Core
Merge remote-tracking branch 'github/master'
WIP : added more functionality to hdf5 handlers
STY : cleaned up and documented ImageHistogram
ENH : made trait mapping more general for integers
EXMP : added an opaquefile example
added dtype notes
STY : renamed dtypes.txt -> dtypes.org so org-mode auto-works
STY : house keeping, organization, and comments
STY : removed un-used import

WIP : renamed sparray -> GridData

 - match the data modeling documentation

WIP : Added data_unit to sparray

 - this is the unit of the voxel values
 - maybe want to get rid of explicit `label_data` flag and replace
it with a property that sorts out the bool value from looking at the
unit
 - need to sort out if this is a string or an object
PEP8 : in tests

WIP : fixed cumsum/cumprod failures

 - ptp is a special snowflake

WIP : more work on getting all of the reduce functions to work

 - added simple tests to make sure that results match numpy
 - need to add tests that axis information getting transformed
   correctly
 - 4 failing test (cumsum and cumprod)

WIP : added wrapper function for function run through reduce

 - likely still buggy,
 - needs tests
ENH : changed examples to use context manager for handlers
BUG : updated examples to use new Distribution* api
BUG : fixed init args on scipy_imread_Handler
DOC : added draft of constrained data types

WIP : added down-cast on methods that do not preserve shape

 - added tests for most down-casting functions
 - not-implemented reduce based functions (which seem to down cast
   on their own if __array_finalize__ raises an error)
WIP : work on classifying what ndarray function need wrapping

WIP : draft of sparray (GridData) extension to ndarray

 - contains _a lot_ of debugging print statements
 - partially functional
STY : removed duplicate import
ENH : added product of tig function synthetic data function
WIP : hdf based Table handlers
ENH : added TableSource and TableSink ABCs
ENH : added abstract base handler for raw tomographic data
BUG : fixed copy-paste bugs in LTThreshold
TST : added tests for auto-generated tools in basic

API : removed tools.basic.ImageDivide

 - Removed because it's behavior is dependent on the details of it's
inputs.  Both FloorDivideImages and TrueDivideImages are available
which will never do something unexpected
ENH : added better error checking to NPFrameSink
CLN : removed un-used imports

RFCT : moved node/tool iteration into a generator

 - more work to make multi-process easy

RFCT : moved global out of _proc_subtool in compose.py

 - This is incremental work to make setting up the multi-process
   version

BLD : add networkx as install dependency

 - hopefully will fix travis

ENH : added basic version of DAG composure

 - will read in DAG, sort out dependancies and then run graph
 - only works on tools with ImageSourec/ImageSink io
 - runs everything in single process
ENH : added option to namedtmpfile to get more than one filename
DOC : point travis badge at correct build page
DOC : updated the git-doc
RENAME : renamed package from pyLightRafters -> pyRafters

BLD : removed scipy build dep

There is logic in image_handler to fail gracefully if it is
not installed.

DOC : more re-organization

 - all handlers modules now have pages
DOC : re-arranged files + inheritance diagrams

RFCT : moved the file handling base-classes out of handler_base

This is in part to clean up code and in part to make the inheritance
diagrams sphinx generates cleaner.
BUG : fixed un-defined variable in gray-scale case
BUG : fixed naming typo

BUG : maybe fixed basic code

 - still untested
BUG : add make_source to OpaqueFile so that it will be non-abstract

BUG : fixed py3k compat issues

 - used xrange instead of range, but importing range from six.moves
   so should really be xrange in py2

ENH : Added numpy backed frame and image source/sink

 - includes simple tests
ENH : Added draft of numpy backed FrameSource
BUG : return instantiated KeyError objects instead of the class

API : made BaseSink.make_source required

This is to make chaining tools in a single process in-memory easy.  We
might discover that there are some handlers that we can't/don't want
to let be used in chains.  If this is the case, we should either add
another class flag `chainable` (like `available`) or move function
out of BaseSink and into a mix-in class.

ENH : added more basic math functions

 - need to add tests for some of these
ENH : add auto-generated binary operation tools

ENH : added basic tool module

 - added thresholding tools
API : added ImageSink class
BUG : added missing return statements, fixed super call

ENH : added code to handle binary images correctly

 - tifffile barfs on bool arrays, cast to uint8 first
TST : added test for context manager

ENH : added draft of tiffwriter

 - does not deal with sequences yet
 - does not deal with meta-data yet
API : added FrameSink class

TST : added synthetic data generation functions

 - random array (can control seed)
 - 2D diagonal gradient

API : added context-manager code to BaseDataHandler

All handlers should now be usable as context managers

API : added resolution and resolution_units

These are for keeping track of the real units of the pixel size.

API : added resolution and resolution_units property

These properties are managed at the FrameSource level

API : changed metadata -> kwarg_dict

 This is to avoid brain-space conflicts with get_metadata and
get_frame_metadata (which will be in subsequent commits).
ENH : added missing require_active decorator
ENH : updated np based distribution classes
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master'

ENH : convert csv_handler to new distribution api

 - use SingleFileHandler to simplify things
BUG : add __init__ so that extern is a proper sub-module

TST : switch testing build script to use conda

 - stolen from PIMS test script
ENH : draft of tiff source handler

API : changed how to deal with importing ND data

 - FrameSource -> returns ND data
 - ImageSource -> return 2D data (sub-class of FrameSource)
 - VolumeSource -> return 3D data (sub-class of FrameSource)
 - SpectrumSource -> (likely to change) return ND array of spectrum data

API : modified DistrobutionSource

 - improved function names
 - added function to get center of bins
 - broke all existing handlers
PEP8

EXT : added tifffile.py and tifffile.c into source tree

Source: http://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/code/tifffile.py

added building code to setup.py to build/install the c
extension
EXMP : Added example tool to exercise new ImageSource

ENH : Added basic ImageSource implementation

 - uses scipy.misc.imread

RFCT : refactored where logic lives if FileHandler family

 Pushed most of the logic up to the base-class

API : tweaked ImageSource required functions a bit

  - still sorting out the best way to design this

API : change BaseDataHandler.metadata return value to dict()

 - return empty dict so that the base function at operate as
   the base of a super() chain

API : added available to ToolBase

Same logic as with BaseDataHandler, should provide tools a way to report
and run-time if they are usable
ENH : Added Korean to HelloWorld

ENH : added available test to util.all_subclasses

Don't return handlers which can't be used.

API : added BaseDataHandler.available clsasmethod

This is to allow handlers to gracefully indicate that all of their
required imports or required external dependencies are not available.

BUG : Patched up py3k issues

 bytes and strings oh my!
TST : added tests for csv handlers
RFCT : reworked csv handler due to changes in BaseDataHandler

TST : added pickling fail test

 - test that exception get raised when trying to pickle active handler
TST : added some simple tests for the BaseDataHandler class

ENH : moved activate/deactivate logic to BaseDataHandler

 - management of the active state is now handled by the base class
 - provide two decorators to make checking the state of active/inactive
   easy

 - still need to over-haul existing classes
ENH : added distribution plotting example tool

API : add make_source to BaseSink

Currently optionally defined function on sub-classes.

The idea is that for pipe-lining data it would be good to be able to
easily create a BaseSorce object from a BaseSink object that results
were just dumped into to use for the next stage.

ENH : added ImageSource handler

Draft of ABC for sourcing images.  It is assumed that most images we
will be interested in working in will actually be sequences.  Design
closely follows pims.

ENH : Added OpaqueFile and OpaqueFigure handlers

sub-class of FileHandler that has no brains and only can return the
path to the backing file.

This is useful as it provides the advantage over a string input in that
 - it indicates that the string is really a file path and a label
 - allows the UI builders to use the same file-selection widgets
   used for the other FileHandlers.

OpaqueFigure provides a non-exhaustive list of file extensions sensible for saving
matplotlib figures.

API : corrected spelling in function name

FileHandler.handler_extenstions -> FileHandler.handler_extensions

ENH : improved available_handler_list and all_subclasses

 - add the base handler to returned list if it is not abstract
 - don't include abstract sub-classes
BUG : deal with py3k pickle move

ENH : added 'hello world' tool

 - takes no parameters, just prints hello world in 3 languages to
   std out
 - exercises unicode
DOC : corrected naming in README.md

BUG/API : fixed kwarg handling for csv kwargs

 - now need to pass csv kwargs as a dict, does not automatically collect
   kwargs to pass through (can see ways to re-implement this if needed)
 - fixed bug where unpickling was not unnesting kwargs properly
ENH : added class method `id` to `BaseDataHandler`
ENH : over-ride default pickling methods to force init to be called

API : made ToolBase objects callable

This is to play-nice with ipython parallel (because bound instance
methods are not pickable).
API : changed how extension filters are handled
API : tweaked api on FileHandler

API : changed tool_tip -> tooltip

As it should be one word
TYPO : fix really stupid renaming bug
VCS : added binary file globs to .gitignore
EXP : added example of how to use a tool

RFCT : renamed data_base -> handler_base

data_base is an astoundingly bad name for a module

(there are three hard things in CS: naming things and of by one bugs)
ENH : added available handler listing function

RFCT : moved _all_subclasses to utils

modified imports accordingly
pep8 : added line
RFCT : finished edits to tool_args

DOC : add docstrings in ToolBase

updated the example tools to source the tutorial correctly.

RFT : refactored how MD get exported

Added class-level (`tool_*`) functions for most MD, instance
level proprieties now just call the class-level methods.

RFT : re-organized tools_base a bit

added some helper functions

BLD : added SNAPSHOT flag

having the version tagged wit the git build makes reloading
annoying as the egg infrastructure adds the install path (which
includes the git SHA) to sys.path python will only find the old version
of modules on `reload` even if a new version is installed.

The ability to tack git versions onto the version might still be
useful for building trackable snapshots.
BUG : fixed sign error
BUG : fixed typo + dtype issues

ENH : added `phash` to ToolBase

Returns the SHA-1 of the tool name + current parameter values.

This can/should be overloaded by daughter classes to also mix
in information about versioning.

PY3K : fixed imports in __init__.py

use of . for local imports is needed in py3k
BLD : added IPython to the dependencies
EXP : added example Tool
INST : updated setup.py + import magic
ENH : added draft of np backed dist source/sink
ENH : re-worked how md about arguments are returned
ENH : finished cleaning out registry code
INST : also install sub-modules

removed InterfaceRegistry

new-style objects already keep track of subclasses (via
`baseKlass.__subclasses__()`).
DOC : README tweaks
DOC : added travis tag to README
TST : adding travis config
BUG : made py3k proof setup.py
TST : added round trip to hdf test

BUG/ENH : fixed issues in reader/writer helper functions

scalar arrays now converted to python scalars.

First round of simple tests for MD_dict

decorator which sub-classes the decorated class from each of the

Dumps the data to a dictionary for use with json

 - can read/write to hdf groups in compliance with DataExchange

DOC : edits to README.md
INST : skeleton of setup.py

Added base classes for specifying argument meta-data
added __init__.py file

Mostly for demonstrating interfaces.

first pass at UML based spec

further work on ToolBase base class

Transcribe meta-data from Ptychography tool.

Starting work to be able to extract json-compatible dict from a tool

Frist pass at using traitlets to mark up classes/parameters

minor edits to mark up
